title.narrative: Emergency lifesaving health response to drought disaster in Kenya that targets affected children, women and men

description.narrative: The main objective of this WHO project is to provide emergency lifesaving health response to drought disaster in Kenya that targets affected children, women and men. This WHO will focus on life saving interventions including scaling up management of medical complications of malnutrition and infectious disease outbreaks, such as cholera, diarrhoea, kala azar, dengue, rift valley fever and measles which are often reported in these counties affected by the drought outbreaks, strengthening the early warning (EWARN) for large scale disease outbreaks both at health facilities and community levels, replenishing of essential lifesaving drugs and critical health commodities and scaling up integrated accelerated interventions in susceptible areas Kenya to 102,711 people, including 7,654 women, 4,600 men and 90,457 children.WHO also expects 5,000 people with disabilities to be among those targeted.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: County health teams supported for response to diarrhoeal diseases, cholera, measles, other emerging alerts, outbreaks and disease rumours
